required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, non-randomized, multicenter, post market release study which will collect electrograms (EGMs) from patients at risk of a suspected insulation failure to the high voltage portion of the defibrillator lead and will evaluate the electrogram signals.

clinical_study.why_stopped: No chance to meet the foreseen target of patients with study endpoint

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Abnormal Electrograms During a Lead Issue
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with at least one instance of abnormal noise during recording. Electrograms will be collected during 24 hours and afterwards abnormalities in the electrograms will be visually identified.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With Abnormal Electrograms and Lead Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the proportion of patients with abnormal electrograms (e.g. high frequency spike) and a high voltage lead failure within 1 month to those patients with abnormal electrograms and no lead failure within 1 month
Identify additional characteristics in the Far-field Electrograms that may halp to identify patients at risk of a high voltage lead failure

study_pop.textblock: Patients with an Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) or a Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Defibrillator (CRT-D) device followed-up at community hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is willing to sign and date the study Informed Consent form
- Subject is at least 18 years of age (or older, if required by local law)
- Subject is willing and able to wear a Holter monitor for up to 24 hours
- Subject has been implanted with a Medtronic ICD or CRT-D device
- Subject has an increased risk of lead insulation breach
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has medical conditions that would limit study participation
- Subject is enrolled in one or more concurrent studies that would confound the results of this study

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Patients at risk of suspected insulation failure to the high voltage portion of the defibrillator lead

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Patients at risk of suspected insulation failure to the high voltage portion of the defibrillator lead

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Abnormal Electrograms During a Lead Issue
outcome.description: Number of patients with at least one instance of abnormal noise during recording. Electrograms will be collected during 24 hours and afterwards abnormalities in the electrograms will be visually identified.
outcome.population: 46 subjects were enrolled and completed the study. All subjects met the inclusion and exclusion criteria. 5 subjects were excluded since they did not have an Holter recording with at least 12 hours of telemetry.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Patients at risk of suspected insulation failure to the high voltage portion of the defibrillator lead

measure.title: Number of Patients With Abnormal Electrograms During a Lead Issue
measure.description: Number of patients with at least one instance of abnormal noise during recording. Electrograms will be collected during 24 hours and afterwards abnormalities in the electrograms will be visually identified.
measure.population: 46 subjects were enrolled and completed the study. All subjects met the inclusion and exclusion criteria. 5 subjects were excluded since they did not have an Holter recording with at least 12 hours of telemetry.

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients With Abnormal Electrograms and Lead Failure
outcome.description: Compare the proportion of patients with abnormal electrograms (e.g. high frequency spike) and a high voltage lead failure within 1 month to those patients with abnormal electrograms and no lead failure within 1 month
outcome.population: There were no patients with a high voltage lead failure, therefore the proportions cannot be estimated nor compared.

outcome.title: Additional Abnormal Electrogram Characteristics
outcome.description: Identify additional characteristics in the Far-field Electrograms that may halp to identify patients at risk of a high voltage lead failure
outcome.population: There were no patients with a high voltage lead failure, therefore the additional characteristics cannot be identified.

reported_events.time_frame: No adverse event collected in this study
reported_events.desc: All-Cause Mortality, Serious, and Other (Not Including Serious) Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Patients at risk of suspected insulation failure to the high voltage portion of the defibrillator lead

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: 41 out of the 46 enrolled subjects completed a Holter recording with at least 12 hours of telemetry, but none of them reached any study endpoint. Therefore enrollment and study were closed and foreseen analyses could have not been performed
